title: Leek Casserole

description: You can't get Merlan? No problem: Alternatively you can simply fry cod fillets. Even homemade fish cakes go well with the mushrooms. We also recommend a mixed green salad as a side dish.

title: Plum Salad with Pecorino Cheese
description: Rinse the plums, cut in half and cut into quarters. Cut the cheese into thin sticks. Mix all salad ingredients together and drizzle with the dressing. Serve sprinkled with chopped walnuts.

title: Scrambled Egg Variation
description: Melt butter in a hot pan and add eggs to pan. Cook while stirring, leave on a low heat for 2-3 minutes so that it slowly cooks. Do not brown. Cook until scrambled eggs are shiny and juicy.

title: Endive Salad with Pears and Blue Cheese
description: Rinse the endives and arugula, divide and shake dry. Halve the pomegranate and remove the seeds and ribs. Peel and halve the pears, remove the cores and cut the halves into slices.

title: Salmon with Buttered Scallions
description: Rinse the scallions, trim and cut into rings. Rinse the parsley, shake dry, pluck the leaves and chop. Melt the butter in a large frying pan and sweat the scallions until tender, around 3-4 minutes. Add the parsley and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.

title: Mixed Salad with Egg and Yogurt Dressing
description: For the dressing, peel the garlic. Rinse chile pepper, cut in half and remove seeds. Add to a blender with garlic, yogurt, oil, lemon juice, vinegar and 1-2 tablespoons water. Season with salt and pepper and blend until creamy. Drizzle over salad and garnish with watercress to serve.

title: Parsley Sauce
description: Mix in the olive oil, stirring constantly. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and let infuse in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Add the sour cream and mix well before serving.

title: Scallops with Asparagus Tips and Caviar
